thread.title: Denver Zombie Crawl is this Saturday
thread.title_full: Denver Zombie Crawl is this Saturday

title: Denver Zombie Crawl is this Saturday
text:
Denver Zombie Crawl is this Saturday at Skyline Park Walking dead descend on Denver 10:49 AM, Oct 16, 2015 zombies | zombie crawl Photo of the 2014 Denver Zombie Crawl from Anica Padilla/7NEWS. Copyright 2015 Scripps Media, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
DENVER - This year’s Zombie Crawl promises to be the largest in history – with over 40,000 undead expected to descend on Denver’s Skyline Park. 
The event at 16th and Arapahoe on Saturday, Oct. 17, beginning at 2 p.m. 
Need ideas for a zombie costume? Try one of these ideas and throw some blood on them: Decorate your bump! Fun maternity costume ideas 
The Zombie Party is free and open to Halloween fans of all ages. 
We do however ask that you bring a non-perishable food item to donate to the Food Bank of the Rockies. 9 a.m. - Organ Trail 12 p.m. - Makeup and costume help 12 p.m.- 3:55 p.m. - DJs, Bands, Games, more! 3:55 p.m. - Thriller! 4 p.m. - Zombie Crawl Parade down 16th St. (Skyline Park to Welton St., u-turn, and back to Skyline!) 5:30 p.m. - Costume Contests @ Skyline Park 6 p.m. - Zombie Crawl after parties 
One of the event's sponsors is ARC Thrift Store, with Colorado’s largest selection of build-your-own zombie costumes. 
Although the event is free, organizers ask that people register at http://eyeheartbrains.com/ so they can get an accurate count to set a World Record. 
Check out other ideas and tips for your costume in our Halloween section. 
Copyright 2015 Scripps Media, Inc. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
